edu.smu.tspell.wordnet
Interface VerbSynset

All Superinterfaces:
Synset
All Known Implementing Classes:
VerbReferenceSynset
public interface VerbSynset
extends Synset

Represents a synset that corresponds to a verb meaning.

One characteristic unique to verb synsets is the inclusion of two types of examples sentences that illustrate how the verbs are used.

The first type of example sentence is referred to as a "frame" and is represented by a short, generic example of how the verb is used with hyphens (dashes) representing a verb form and text in all capital letters representing an unsupplied portion of text that would be present to form a proper sentence. For example: Somebody ---- whether INFINITIVE

The other type of example sentence is referred to as a "template" and is represented by a more real-world example with a printf()-compatible substitution field ("%s") within the portion of the text where the verb is inserted. For example: The men %s the chairs.

Aside from the nature of the sentences, the primary difference between frames and templates is that templates are normally displayed with the verb appearing in the substitution field, so for example if the verb is "fix", the example template would be returned as The men fix the chairs..

See Also:
Five Papers on WordNet ("English Verbs as a Semantic Net")

Method Detail

getHypernyms

public VerbSynset[] getHypernyms()
                          throws WordNetException
Returns the direct hypernyms (superordinates type) of this type.

For example, to "verbalize" is a hypernym of "shout".

Note: In most cases there is exactly one hypernym, but WordNet does contain verb synsets with more than one (e.g., "warm up").

Returns:
The direct hypernyms of this synset.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getTroponyms

public VerbSynset[] getTroponyms()
                          throws WordNetException
Returns the direct troponyms (hyponyms / subordinate types) of this type.

For example, "shout" is a troponym / hyponym / subordinate type of "verbalize".

Returns:
The list of direct hyponyms of this synset.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getEntailments

public VerbSynset[] getEntailments()
                            throws WordNetException
Returns this verb synset's entailments, which are things that this verb implies.

For example, "snore" implies "sleep".

Returns:
Entailments associated with this synset.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getOutcomes

public VerbSynset[] getOutcomes()
                         throws WordNetException
Returns the outcomes of this verb synset's action, that is things that this verb can "cause".

For example, "remind" is a cause of "remember".

Returns:
Things that this verb synset can cause.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getPhrases

public WordSense[] getPhrases(String wordForm)
                       throws WordNetException
Returns the word senses representing cases where this verb is used as part of a verb phrase ("phrasal verb").

For example, "breathe" is found in the phrases "breathe in" and "breathe out".

Parameters:
wordForm - Word form for which to return antonyms.
Returns:
Senses related to the specified word form.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getVerbGroup

public VerbSynset[] getVerbGroup()
                          throws WordNetException
Returns a set of verb senses that have similar meaning.

For example, "talk" and "write" belong to the same verb group.

Returns:
Senses that have a similar meaning.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getTopics

public NounSynset[] getTopics()
                       throws WordNetException
Identifies the topics with which this synset is associated.

For example, "bandage" is within the domain of "medicine".

Returns:
Topics / subjects associated with this synset.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getRegions

public NounSynset[] getRegions()
                        throws WordNetException
Identifies the regions with which this synset is associated.

For example, "judder" is a term associated with "Great Britain".

Returns:
Regions associated with this synset.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getUsages

public NounSynset[] getUsages()
                       throws WordNetException
Identifies the usage types associated with this synset.

For example, "play hooky" is a "slang" term.

Returns:
Usage types associated with this synset.
Throws:
WordNetException - An error occurred retrieving data.

getSentenceFrames

public String[] getSentenceFrames()
Returns the sentence frames (if any) associated with this verb meaning. Sentence frames are examples of how the verb can be used / applied, and all the frames returned by this method apply to all word forms in the synset.

Returns:
Sentence frames associated with all word forms in this synset.
See Also:
Format of Lexicographer Files ("Verb Frames")

getSentenceFrames

public String[] getSentenceFrames(String wordForm)
Returns the sentence frames (if any) that are specific to a particular word form within this synset, where sentence frames are examples of how the word form can be used / applied.

Parameters:
wordForm - Word form for which to return sentence frames.
Returns:
Sentence frames that are specific to the word form.
See Also:
Format of Lexicographer Files ("Verb Frames")

getSentenceTemplates

public String[] getSentenceTemplates(String wordForm)
Returns example sentences (if any) that are specific to a particular word form within this synset, where templates are examples of how the word form can be used / applied.

Parameters:
wordForm - Word form for which to return sentence templates.
Returns:
Sentence templates that are specific to the word form.
See Also:
Format of WordNet database files ("Verb Example Sentences")
